contexts.context: "What <mark>tricks</mark> can your troupe perform?" asked the wizard to the lead...

...perform are real with no illusions. We wish we knew <mark>tricks</mark>, for it's far too time-consuming to have to...
...to scheme against Lord Dagonn, and won. When his <mark>trick</mark> succeeded, Dagon was cast into Oblivion. However, in...
...of his betrayal, Dagon struck out against the mortal who <mark>tricked</mark> him. Chimere's pact assured that he would live forever in his...
...marvelous property of turning the blow of an oathbreaker. Chimere <mark>tricked</mark> Dagon into swearing an oath against the Powers which he had...
Harithoel ignored S'Riizh, murmuring, "The <mark>trick</mark> as I've heard it is to anticipate where your target's going...
...just as he had planned. "Like you said, the <mark>trick</mark> is to anticipate where your target's going to go and aim...
When Sheogorath rebelled against the Tribunal, he <mark>tricked</mark> the moon Baar Dau into forsaking its appointed path through Oblivion...
